item.title: By: Stephen
item.dc:creator: Stephen
item.description:
Great article Anita! I too share a love of Dukkah...such a simple crowd-pleaser when it comes time to entertain guests.
Our family has experimented with including additional spices that give our standard Dukkah more of a Moroccan flavour (cinnamon, ground cloves, allspice, cayenne pepper, ground ginger) and with great results. Nowadays we usually just cheat by adding pre-packaged Moroccan seasoning mix :). Still tastes amazing! Hard to go wrong with a good Dukkah I suppose.
Keep the great articles coming! :D
item.content:encoded:
Great article Anita! I too share a love of Dukkah…such a simple crowd-pleaser when it comes time to entertain guests.

Our family has experimented with including additional spices that give our standard Dukkah more of a Moroccan flavour (cinnamon, ground cloves, allspice, cayenne pepper, ground ginger) and with great results. Nowadays we usually just cheat by adding pre-packaged Moroccan seasoning mix :). Still tastes amazing! Hard to go wrong with a good Dukkah I suppose.

Keep the great articles coming! ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
Hi everyone!
Hi Arwen - Thanks! The pistachios give a splash of pretty green to the mix - and taste great!
Hi Lorraine - It's a great recipe, very similar to what I had at the restaurant. Looking forward to making some different recipes.
Hi Leela - I hope you try it!
Hi Alexandra - It's not heaps common, I don't see if around much. Hope you like it!
Hi Beta Gal - Thanks! It didn't really sound like something I would eat either, but glad I did. I don't see it at heaps of restaurants - I have a little left over if you want to try some? :)
Hi FFichiban - Thanks! It's a lovely combination of flavours :)
Hi Jeena - Hehe, glad someone else searches for recipes once they've tried something :)
Hi Ann - Great to hear it's new to many people, hope you try and like the recipe!
Hi Barbara - Thanks, I like my cute bowls :) . You'll be able to make it for much cheaper than anywhere would be selling anyway :)
item.content:encoded:
Hi everyone!

Hi Arwen – Thanks! The pistachios give a splash of pretty green to the mix – and taste great!

Hi Lorraine – It’s a great recipe, very similar to what I had at the restaurant. Looking forward to making some different recipes.

Hi Leela – I hope you try it!

Hi Alexandra – It’s not heaps common, I don’t see if around much. Hope you like it!

Hi Beta Gal – Thanks! It didn’t really sound like something I would eat either, but glad I did. I don’t see it at heaps of restaurants – I have a little left over if you want to try some? ðŸ™‚

Hi FFichiban – Thanks! It’s a lovely combination of flavours ðŸ™‚

Hi Jeena – Hehe, glad someone else searches for recipes once they’ve tried something ðŸ™‚

Hi Ann – Great to hear it’s new to many people, hope you try and like the recipe!

Hi Barbara – Thanks, I like my cute bowls ðŸ™‚ . You’ll be able to make it for much cheaper than anywhere would be selling anyway ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Beta Gal
item.dc:creator: Beta Gal
item.description: Wow, I've never heard of dukkah before. First of all good for you for trying something new, its great when that pays off. It doesn't sound like something I would normally try, but after hearing that you liked it, next time I see it on the menu I'll give it a go.
item.content:encoded: Wow, I’ve never heard of dukkah before. First of all good for you for trying something new, its great when that pays off. It doesn’t sound like something I would normally try, but after hearing that you liked it, next time I see it on the menu I’ll give it a go.
